snippet: With a crucial decision on President Obama’s health care law due soon, a book by Supreme Court Justice, Antonin Scalia, on how he interprets law is well-timed.
abstract: Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia's new book Reading Law: The Interpretation of Legal Texts is studded with telling asides and intimations about past and future decisions, and could shed some light on the upcoming Supreme Court decision on the health care law.
lead_paragraph: With a crucial decision on President Obama’s health care law due soon, a book by Supreme Court Justice, Antonin Scalia, on how he interprets law is well-timed.

headline.seo: In Scalia’s New Book, Hints of Health Ruling
headline.main: Hints in New Scalia Book of Views on Health Law
headline.print_headline: Hints in New Scalia Book Of Views on Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
